news_header: The UK economy grew by 0.1% in the last quarter of the previous year, driven by construction and services, despite predictions of contraction. However, living standards fell slightly compared to 2023.
news_original_title: Surprise growth in UK economy at end of 2024
news_text: Concerns about sluggish growth persist due to rising taxes and costs for businesses. The Bank of England has reduced its growth forecast and cut interest rates. While some sectors performed well, overall economic sentiment remains low, and the government acknowledges the challenges ahead.
